titles.title: To terminate the authority under title 5, United States Code, under which the head of an agency may fix certain age limits for an original appointment as a law enforcement officer.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service.

bill.summary: 6/13/2000--Introduced. Amends Federal Civil Service provisions, with respect to maximum-age entrance requirements for the competitive service, to terminate the authority under which the head of an agency may determine and fix: (1) the minimum and maximum limits of age within which an original appointment may be made to a position as a law enforcement officer; and (2) the maximum age limit for an original appointment to such a position.
